author: barnabasbusa
content:
Current testing config: 
```yaml
participants:
# Supernodes
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerdas-initial-sync
    cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-subnets]
  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das-devnet-2
    cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-data-column-subnets]
  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das
    cl_extra_params: [--p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled]
  - cl_type: nimbus
    cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:peerdas-p2p
    cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-subnets=true]
# Non supernodes
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerdas-initial-sync
  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das-devnet-2
  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das
  - cl_type: nimbus
    cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:peerdas-p2p
  - cl_type: lodestar
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lodestar:peerDAS
    cl_extra_params: [--persistNetworkIdentity]
network_params:
  eip7594_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7594_fork_version: "0x50000038"
snooper_enabled: true
global_log_level: debug
additional_services:
  - dora
  - goomy_blob
```

author: manunlp
content:
For information, the config I used:
```yaml
participants:
# Supernodes
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerdas-initial-sync
    cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-subnets]
  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das-devnet-2
    cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-data-column-subnets]
  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das
    cl_extra_params: [--p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled]
  # - cl_type: nimbus
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:peerdas-p2p
  #   cl_extra_params: [--subscribe-all-subnets=true]
# Non supernodes
  # - cl_type: prysm
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerdas-initial-sync
  # - cl_type: lighthouse
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:das-devnet-2
  # - cl_type: teku
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das
  # - cl_type: nimbus
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/nimbus-eth2:peerdas-p2p
  # - cl_type: lodestar
  #   cl_image: ethpandaops/lodestar:peerDAS
  #   cl_extra_params: [--persistNetworkIdentity]
network_params:
  eip7594_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7594_fork_version: "0x50000038"
snooper_enabled: true
global_log_level: debug
additional_services:
  - dora
  - goomy_blob
```

author: manunlp
content:
It seems Prysm is by default subscribed to all subnets, even when the `--subscribe-to-all-subnets` flag it not set in the YAML configuration file.

`docker ps --no-trunc` shows:

```
c6c99cad3be49bbd52e4f2c8c40e580efbcacaa1a1684624c1ebeb4428f3ea94   peerdas-bn:latest                              "/beacon-chain --accept-terms-of-use=true <...> --subscribe-all-subnets=true <...>"
```

Probably because of https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/blob/c8b9b19c045f6075fa02f9abf8f761a5a8056ba3/src/cl/prysm/prysm_launcher.star#L265 ?

author: barnabasbusa
content: ah damn, good catch

author: barnabasbusa
content: I can remove that

author: barnabasbusa
content: I would expect prysm to throw an error and crash if a flag is defined twice.

author: manunlp
content: I cannot say I do not agree.

author: barnabasbusa
content: fixed now.
